page.title: 16MAISEMORE HONEY FARM
page.content: BEE KEEPING FOR EXPORT Just north of the village is Maisemore Apiaries, a farm with over 800 hives on surrounding land. It was started about 50 years ago by the present owner's father with only one hive. There is a large workshop where hives and other bee-keeping equipment are made. Honey and beeswax are processed for sale, in fact several types of honey are obtained such as clover and oil seed rape varieties. The main Â£harvest' season is July and August. The company operates a thriving mail order business, with customers as far away as Ireland and Spain. Local people call to buy honey and they enjoy having the bees in the area as they pollinate their plants and fruit trees. Maisemore honey costs 120p/lb and beeswax about 300p/lb. It could cost 100 pounds to set up your own new hive.
